p: Approximately 19 PD-causing genes, including ten autosomal dominant and nine autosomal recessive ones, have been identified [ 19]. Notably, most genome-wide association study (GWAS) hits are driven by noncoding variations and most probably are associated with gene expression regulation [ 16, 20]. Multiple lines of evidence suggest that the alterations in gene expression are associated with PD pathology, and epigenetic mechanisms play an essential role in the pathophysiology of this disorder [ 16].
